p.s: With her text, Ankita Mitra wants to gain more attention for the devastating effects and causes of Environmentalenvironmental pollution.
She wants the reader to realize how it effectsaffects every single one of us.
Mitra uses a deliberate choice of words like hazardous (l. 2), devastating (l. 13).

With the immense contrasts of humenhumans having huge industrial progress (l. 15) and living in an age of science and technology (l. 9), but also creating a human made environmental pollution (l. 28) and an era of mass extinction (l. 27) on cost of their own health makes the readereader realize, how little and unimportant human beings are.
There's also an enumeration in line 23 synthetic detergents, nitrogen fertilizers.
With emotive devices like her feeling heartening (l. 35) and telling how it is too late very soon in l. 38.
She makes the reader emotional and documented facts like the tragedy in BophalBhopal (l. 29-33), she brings up examples.
In l. 17-21, she asks indirect questions, to make the reader think about it.
In conclusion we can say, that she uses stylistic and communicative devices very well to make the reader feel the emotions, she had by writing it.
